meanings.definition: To take back possession of something.
meanings.sent1: She quickly reseizes her toy from her little brother.
meanings.sent2: The detective reseizes the stolen painting from the thief.
meanings.sent3: After the cat reseizes the mouse toy, it proudly parades around the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun reseizes the sky with its radiant light every morning.
meanings.sent5: The determined climber reseizes the mountain peak after a challenging climb.

meanings.sent1: He reseizes the opportunity to prove himself after failing the first time.
meanings.sent2: The police officer reseizes the escaped criminal before he can flee.
meanings.sent3: The magician reseizes the disappearing rabbit and makes it reappear in the hat.
meanings.sent4: The storm reseizes its strength and unleashes a powerful gust of wind.
meanings.sent5: The athlete reseizes the lead in the race with a burst of speed.
